key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares exceed the homepage about 99% of the time, carrying a modest 0.63% average premium.
MSE delivers nearly perfect fare parity with the homepage, showing over 99% aligned fares.
GDS fares maintain a consistent 52–54% premium over the homepage across nearly all itineraries.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Nearly all itineraries show higher OTA prices, though the premium averages only about 0.63%.
OTA unavailability stays below 2% but shows notable increases of up to 52% in the Far Out window.
The OTA price difference remains under 1%, indicating consistent but minor markups.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Around 1% of itineraries overall; up 23% week over week and as high as 52% for Far Out bookings.
No matching fares identified, implying zero direct parity with the airline’s site.
Represents nearly 99% of observed fares; average premiums under 1% across weekly and monthly views.
No instances where OTA undercuts the homepage fare.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Across this category, 99% of fares are OTA Higher with only a ~0.63% price premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For departures from ET, OTA pricing is higher in almost all cases; no lower or equivalent fares.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA higher nearly 99% of the time, with non-availability rising by 6% since last week.
OTA higher in about 99% of itineraries; ‘not found’ jumped 52% week over week but remains under 2%.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over 99% of MSE fares aligned with the airline's site, reflecting virtually no price undercuts or premiums.
A small fraction of routes (up to 1.06%) were not found on MSE for far-out bookings, but that share has recently fallen to 0%.
No fluctuations in relative pricing over the past weeks and month, indicating stable MSE parity.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Rare missing listings, peaking at 1.06% for some far-out routes, now decreasing to none.
Nearly 100% of itineraries matched the airline’s website across all timeframes, demonstrating consistent parity.
No instances recorded, indicating no undercutting by the MSE channel.
No observations of higher fares, signaling no premium charged by MSE.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Nearly all short-haul routes (99.6% last week) matched the site, with a negligible 0.4% missing listings soon disappearing.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Close to 100% fare parity on Ethiopian origins, with minimal missing itineraries dropping from 0.4% to 0% over time.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Full alignment of prices across last week and previous periods, with no missing or misaligned fares.
Initially 1.06% of routes not found last week, now improved to full availability, maintaining 100% price matches.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS fares remain above website rates in over 99% of cases, averaging a 52–54% premium last week.
No occurrences of same-price or channel-lower fares, underscoring a persistent markup on GDS.
Week-over-week frequency shifts remain minor, indicating little change in the established premium.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Offers not found on GDS account for roughly 0.1%, showing near-complete coverage.
No matching fare levels, indicating consistent fare differentials in this channel.
Nearly all recorded GDS fares exceed website prices by about 52–54%, with limited fluctuation.
No channel-lower fares observed, reinforcing GDS’s higher price position.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Similar to overall results, GDS fares are higher nearly 100% of the time, at a 52–54% markup.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: All monitored itineraries from ET show GDS fares consistently higher by about 52–54%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS outpricing the website in almost every close-in case, at a 52–54% rate difference.
Near-complete GDS dominance, with a 51–54% premium versus direct website fares.
